headline: But I Loved Her Still
description: A poetic reflection on the complexity of love, parting, and the tenderness that remains beyond betrayal.

fieldDefinitions.resonantThread: Even in parting, the heart remembers with tenderness.
fieldDefinitions.whyItMatters: This post serves as a testament to emotional maturity and the nuanced understanding that true love can persist without possession or reconciliation.

motifMap.position: central metaphor in both poem and image
in the manâ€™s hand, signifying unresolved expression

motifMap.meaning: connection that remains despite physical separation
motifMap.position: pool of water beneath the figures

fieldDefinitions.articleExcerpt:
I do not know what was true.
I only know what I felt.
...
You are not the enemy.
My great love.

associatedMedia.description: A mythic-style illustration depicting two lovers parting under a crescent moon, with their reflections holding hands across a still pool.
